binary.name: trim_fit
binary.syntax: trim_fit [-vb] [-sd yyyymmdd] [-st hr:mn] [-ed yyyymmdd] [-et hr:mn] [-ex hr:mn] [-cp cpid] [-cn channel] [fitacfname]
trim_fit -i [-vb] [-sd yyyymmdd] [-st hr:mn] [-ed yyyymmdd] [-et hr:mn] [-ex hr:mn] [-cp cpid] [-cn channel] fitacfname inxinput
trim_fit -old [-vb] [-sd yyyymmdd] [-st hr:mn] [-ed yyyymmdd] [-et hr:mn] [-ex hr:mn] [-cp cpid] [-cn channel] fitinput fitoutput
trim_fit -i -old [-vb] [-sd yyyymmdd] [-st hr:mn] [-ed yyyymmdd] [-et hr:mn] [-ex hr:mn] [-cp cpid] [-cn channel] fitinput fitoutput inxinput inxoutput

option.od: print the help message and exit.
verbose. Log information to the console.
extract starting from the date yyyymmdd.
extract starting from the time hr:mn.
stop extracting at the date yyyymmdd.
stop extracting at the time hr:mn.
extract an interval whose extent is hr:mn.
extract only those records with the program identifier cp.
extract only those records from channel channel.
filename of the fitacf format file to trim. If this is omitted, the file will be read from standard input
index files are available, for fit format files, an index file is created for the ouput file.
filename of the index file associated with the fit or fitacf format input file.
filename of the index file to create.
the input file is a fit format file.
filename of the fit format file to trim.
filename of the fit format file to create.

synopsis.p: Extracts a section from a fit or fitacf format file.

description.p: Extracts a section from a fit or fitacf format file.
If the input file is a fitacf format file, the extracted section will be written to standard output

example.description: Extracts a one-hour section starting at 11:00UT from the fit file "20000110.kap.dat" to produce the fit file called "200001101.kap.dat".

Extract a six-hour section starting at 22:00UT April 10, 1999 from the fitacf file "19990410.gbr.fitacf" to produce the fit file "1999041022.gbr.fitacf". Only those records with a program identifier number of 150 will be extracted.
